paper_abstract: Let G be a plane graph, let tau(G) (resp. tau'(G)) be the minimum number of vertices (resp. edges) that meet all cycles of G, and let nu(G) (resp. nu'(G)) be the maximum number of vertex-disjoint (resp. edge-disjoint) cycles in G. In this note we show that tau(G)a parts per thousand currency sign3 nu(G) and tau'(G)a parts per thousand currency sign4 nu'(G)-1; our proofs are constructive, which yield polynomial-time algorithms for finding corresponding objects with the desired properties.
paper_title: Approximate min-max relations on plane graphs
